title: Liverpool's worst January
text:
Liverpool suffered worst January for winning games last month By Adam Smith Last Updated: 01/02/17 9:36pm Liverpool suffered their worst January during the Premier League era last month - but how bad was it? 
January is Liverpool's worst month for winning games during the Premier League era, but last month was also their worst to date. 
The Reds only recorded one victory from nine fixtures in all competitions - a 1-0 win at Plymouth in an FA Cup third round replay, before being dumped out of the competition at the hands of Wolves on Saturday. Andreas Weimann celebrates in front of the Kop after putting Wolves 2-0 up against Liverpool 
Liverpool also crashed out of the EFL Cup following a 1-0 (2-0 agg) semi-final, second leg defeat to Southampton last week. Liverpool's Daniel Sturridge rues a missed chance against Southampton at Anfield 
In the Premier League, Jurgen Klopp's men suffered a 3-2 defeat to Swansea a fortnight ago after draws against Manchester United and Sunderland earlier in the month. 
The Reds are now 10 points behind league leaders Chelsea after a 1-1 draw with the Blues at Anfield on Tuesday. Liverpool drew 1-1 with Chelsea at Anfield on Tuesday 
In total, Liverpool's win percentage last month was almost twice as bad as their previous worst January results from the Premier League era in 1992/93 and 2008/09 - when they won one of five fixtures in both seasons. Liverpool suffered their worst January during the Premier League era last month Also See:
